title: David Follett
text:
Sir David Henry Follett (5 September 1907 – 11 May 1982) was an English curator who was Director of the <a href="Science%20Museum%20%28London%29">Science Museum</a>, <a href="London">London</a> from 1960 to 1973.
Follett was born in <a href="Kingston%2C%20Surrey">Kingston, Surrey</a>, and attended <a href="Rutlish%20Grammar%20School">Rutlish Grammar School</a> (1919–26). He then studied <a href="physics">physics</a> in the <a href="Clarendon%20Laboratory">Clarendon Laboratory</a> at <a href="Oxford%20University">Oxford University</a> as a student at <a href="Brasenose%20College%2C%20Oxford">Brasenose College</a>.
Follett joined the Science Museum in 1937 as an Assistant Keeper, when Colonel <a href="E.%20E.%20B.%20Mackintosh">E. E. B. Mackintosh</a> was the Director. He was later Director of the museum from 1960 to 1973.
Follett was also an author and a Fellow of the <a href="Museums%20Association">Museums Association</a>.
Follett was <a href="knight">knight</a>ed for his contribution to the museum world in 1967. He was married to Helen Allison, Lady Follett, who died in 1996.
